name: SDLU - The SDL Utility library
short_description:
The SDL Utility Library
Copyright (c) 2013 Aggelos Kolaitis <neoaggelos@gmail.com>

http://sdlu.bitbucket.org

The SDL Utility Library (SDLU) is a cross-platform library that provides APIs
to make development of SDL2 applications faster and easier.

SDLU officially supports Windows, Linux, Mac OS X, iOS and Android. There is
also expiremental support for the Raspberry Pi.

SDLU is written in C, but can be natively used in C++.

It is distributed under the terms of the zlib license, see COPYING.
For other software and/or source code included in this distribution,
see COPYING-others.

See INSTALL, README-cmake and README-configure for instructions on how to
build the library. Then, check out the examples in "test" to get started.
Documentation can be found in the header files in "include", and doxygen can
be used to generate the docs in HTML format.

For questions, suggestions or thoughts email me at "neoaggelos@gmail.com"
summary: SDLU is a cross-platform library to support development of SDL2 apps
